segments.text: Not well . I ’ Ve been feeling pretty lonely lately .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But you have so many friends ! How could you be lonely ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You know what they say'a friend to all is a friend to none ' . I don ’ t feel like I really know any of my friends . In fact , I should probably call them acquaintances , not friends .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What about me ? I ’ m your friend .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know you are , you are my girlfriend . I wish I had a guy friend to hang out with sometimes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know what you mean . I find it difficult to make new friends , too . It ’ s not as easy as it was when we were young , is it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ Ve made a lot of new friends since I started learning English . Maybe you could join a club or take a class to make some new friends .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What kind of qualities do you look for in a friend ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m not sure . I guess I ’ d like to meet some people who have a positive attitude and want to have a good time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: People who play ultimate Frisbee have a positive attitude ; maybe you should join the ultimate Frisbee club .
segments.speaker: S1
